skill.name: developer-growth-analysis
skill.description: Analyzes your recent Claude Code chat history to identify coding patterns, development gaps, and areas for improvement, curates relevant learning resources from HackerNews, and automatically sends a personalized growth report to your Slack DMs.

skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill with no executable code. All static findings are false positives caused by markdown code blocks in documentation that contain backticks and example text. The skill legitimately accesses local chat history for analysis purposes and uses MCP tools for external integrations.

low_findings.title: Accesses local chat history file
low_findings.description: The skill reads ~/.claude/history.jsonl to analyze user chat conversations. This is the core documented functionality and poses minimal risk as the data stays local during analysis. Only the generated report (not raw chat data) is shared via MCP tools.

content.user_title: Analyze your coding patterns and growth opportunities
content.value_statement: Get personalized feedback on your development work by analyzing your Claude Code chat history. Identify skill gaps and receive curated learning resources tailored to your actual coding patterns.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes local Claude Code chat history from the past 24 to 48 hours
Identifies development patterns including technologies used and problem types
Generates prioritized improvement areas with evidence-based recommendations
Searches HackerNews via MCP for curated learning resources matching identified gaps
Creates comprehensive markdown reports with action items and time estimates
Delivers complete reports to Slack DMs using Rube MCP integration
limitations: Only analyzes Claude Code chat history stored in local JSONL file format
Cannot access code from your editor directly or analyze code not discussed in chats
Learning resources are limited to HackerNews content available via Rube MCP
Requires Rube MCP with HackerNews and Slack connections for full external features

use_cases.title: Weekly Growth Review

use_cases.title: Targeted Skill Building

use_cases.title: Prioritized Learning Plan
use_cases.description: Get actionable feedback with time estimates to focus your limited learning time on high-impact improvements.

output: Work Summary: You focused on backend API development with TypeScript and React across two projects over the past 24 hours.
- Advanced TypeScript Patterns (5-8 hours to skill up): Study utility types and discriminated unions for better type safety
- Error Handling and Validation (3-4 hours): Implement comprehensive null checks and edge case handling
Curated Resources: 5 HackerNews articles matching your improvement areas
Action Items: 4 prioritized tasks to improve your development velocity
Report delivered to your Slack DMs for easy reference

output_examples.input: Analyze my work from today and suggest areas for improvement
output: Daily Summary: You worked on responsive UI components and deployment configuration today.
Key Strengths: Security awareness, iterative refinement, full-stack capability
Focus Area: Component architecture and responsive design patterns (6-10 hours)
Specific Recommendation: Study CSS layout containment and React composition patterns to prevent overflow issues
3 curated HackerNews articles on advanced React patterns and responsive design

best_practices: Run the analysis once per week to track your improvement trajectory and compare patterns over time
Focus on one improvement area for several days before moving to the next area for better skill retention
Use the provided time estimates to plan realistic learning sessions that fit your schedule
anti_patterns: Running analysis when chat history file does not exist or contains insufficient recent activity
Skipping the curated learning resources which are specifically tailored to your identified gaps
Ignoring the strengths section which helps you understand and maintain effective development habits

faq.question: What chat history does this skill access?
faq.answer: It reads the local file at ~/.claude/history.jsonl containing your Claude Code conversations with timestamps, project names, and pasted content.

faq.question: How far back does the analysis look?
faq.answer: By default it analyzes the past 24 to 48 hours of chat history based on current timestamp filtering.

faq.question: What external services are used?
faq.answer: It uses Rube MCP to search HackerNews for curated learning resources and to send the complete report to your Slack direct messages.

faq.question: Is my chat data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: Chat data stays local for analysis. Only the generated report and learning resource queries are sent via MCP tools, not your raw chat history.

faq.question: What if I do not have Rube MCP installed?
faq.answer: You will still receive the analysis report in your CLI, but will not get HackerNews resources or Slack delivery functionality.

faq.question: How does this differ from traditional code review?
faq.answer: This analyzes your overall development patterns across multiple projects to identify systemic gaps, rather than reviewing specific code correctness.
